options.name: Trapper
options.description: Gain +1 Senses and +1 Xenology. You can craft basic traps with minimal materials.

options.name: Trap Specialist
options.description: Your traps are more difficult to detect. Creatures trying to spot your traps have a 1d4 penalty to their check.

options.name: Tranquilizing Expert
options.description: You can craft tranquilizing ammunition for any ranged weapon. Targets hit by this ammunition must make a Resilience check or fall unconscious for 1 hour.

options.name: Wilderness Knowledge
options.description: Gain +1 Xenology and +1 Senses. You can identify creature types by examining their tracks or other signs.

options.name: Action : Quick Trap
options.description: Set up a trap in an adjacent area as an action. Creatures entering that area must make a Senses check or trigger the trap, becoming immobilized or taking 1d8 damage.

options.name: Advanced Tranquilizers
options.description: Your tranquilizers now affect creatures one size larger than normally possible. The target gets a 1d4 penalty on their resistance check.

options.name: Camouflaged Traps
options.description: Your traps are virtually invisible. Creatures searching for your traps have a 2d4 penalty to their check. Your traps deal +1d6 damage or impose an additional negative effect on targets.

options.name: Action : Control Environment
options.description: You can manipulate a 20ft area of terrain to aid your trapping, creating difficult terrain, concealment, or other tactical advantages that last for 10 minutes.

options.name: Specialized Toxins
options.description: You can craft tranquilizers and poisons that target specific species with increased effectiveness. These concoctions bypass 50% of the target's resistances to such effects.

options.name: Master Trapper
options.description: Your traps can now trigger multiple effects in sequence. Additionally, you can set up a network of connected traps that you can trigger remotely as a bonus action. Gain +1 to Xenology and Senses.
